title: NLL: suggested rewritten input types should preserve user-written lifetimes when needed

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
While working on #52663, I saw a collection of cases where the `.nll.stderr` files shows that we are currently generating a diagnostic where we suggest the user do something like change a `&`-type to a `&mut`-type, but the problem is that in adding the `mut`, we seem to lose bits of the original input type that it probably needs, such as explicit lifetimes.

See for example:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/did_you_mean/issue-39544.nll.stderr#L12-L13

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/did_you_mean/issue-39544.nll.stderr#L37-L38

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/did_you_mean/issue-39544.nll.stderr#L54-L55

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/span/borrowck-borrow-overloaded-auto-deref-mut.nll.stderr#L28-L29

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/span/borrowck-borrow-overloaded-auto-deref-mut.nll.stderr#L60-L61

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/span/mut-arg-hint.nll.stderr#L12-L13

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/trivial-bounds-inconsistent-copy-reborrow.nll.stderr#L4-L5

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/fefe81605d6111faa8dbb3635ab2c51d59de740a/src/test/ui/trivial-bounds-inconsistent-copy-reborrow.nll.stderr#L12-L13
